remarks: Two ways to say that a join is defined.  (Contributed by NM, 9-Sep-2018.)
statement:
joindef.u $e |- U = ( lub ` K ) $.
joindef.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
joindef.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. V ) $.
joindef.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. W ) $.
joindef.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. Z ) $.
joindef $p |- ( ph -> ( <. X , Y >. e. dom .\/ <-> { X , Y } e. dom U ) ) $.
